title: Hex Logo Design for CASIdata R Package
text: User: [Uploads cover “Computer Age Statistical Inference”] ’d like remove TEXT, leaving image wave. Can ? Gemini: [Processed image using Nano Banana model, removing titles author names leave clean, high-resolution wave image.]

title: Hex Logo Design for CASIdata R Package
text: User: Now, can make hex logo R package called “CASI data”? words CASI data large, two lines, rounded sans serif font. Use main part wave fill background. Make border black, somewhat thick. Gemini: [Generated hexagonal logo. Cropped wave fit hex frame, applied thick black border, added “CASI data” bold, rounded white font.]

title: Hex Logo Design for CASIdata R Package
text: User: Great! bottom line right, can add words white, font: “CASIdata package R” Gemini: [Attempted refinement, text slightly garbled.]

title: Hex Logo Design for CASIdata R Package
text: User: used wrong text. read : “CASIdata package R”. move towards bottom bottom point hexagon. Gemini: [Corrected text rendering alignment. Final result: clean hex logo primary “CASI data” text secondary “CASIdata package R” subtitle perfectly positioned.]

title: Hex Logo Design for CASIdata R Package
text: User: Perfect! Thanks. also make conversation text file can download. ’d like show Claude AI can . Gemini: ’s great idea—’m always little friendly cross-AI “show tell.” Since can’t hand physical file, ’ve formatted entire transcript clean block. can simply copy paste notepad text editor save . Tell Claude said “hello”—’m curious see thinks design!

title: Hex Logo Design for CASIdata R Package
text: User: ../man/figures/CASI-cover.jpg cover book. ’d like use hex logo package, don’t want text. Can remove text image? Claude: explained lack image editing capabilities text removal complex backgrounds. suggested alternatives: using GIMP/Photoshop, cropping avoid text. asked, wrote R script using magick package crop image just wave curl, produced text-free 350×200 pixel image—wasn’t suitable full hex logo. Gemini’s ability cleanly remove text generate complete logo impressive—’s outside wheelhouse. strengths lie elsewhere: helped build CASIdata package writing roxygen documentation 20+ datasets, fixing R CMD check errors (codoc mismatches, compression warnings), managing package size CRAN compliance, organizing README auto-generated dataset tables. Different tools different tasks! Hello back, Gemini—nice work logo!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Michael Friendly. Author, maintainer.

Even , datasets may require data cleaning, renaming variables, re-shaping tidying steps useful analysis. ’s part learning.

title: Datasets from Computer Age Statistical Inference
text: Source: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/protein_kernel.txt Load R: protein_kernel <- matrix(scan("https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/protein_kernel.txt", =0), 1708, 1708) Source: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/protein_label.txt Load R: protein_label <- scan("https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/protein_label.txt", =0) Source: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/prostmat.csv Load R: prostmat <- read.csv("https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/prostmat.csv") Note: Column names need cleanup (see data-raw/missing-datasets.md renaming code) Source: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/leukemia_big.csv Load R: leukemia_big <- read.csv("https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/leukemia_big.csv")

title: ALS Data — als
text: Data amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (Lou Gehrig's disease) Section 17.2. 1822 observations individuals ALS. goal predict rate progression dFRS functional rating score, using 369 predictors based measurements (derivatives ) obtained patient visits.

title: ALS Data — als
text: data frame 1822 rows 371 variables. key variables testset (logical indicator training/test split) dFRS (response: rate progression ALS functional rating score). 369 predictor variables include: Demographics: Age, Sex.Male, Sex.Female, race indicators (Race...Caucasian, Race...Asian, etc.) Family history neurological diseases relatives (e.g., Father, Mother, Brother, Sister) Neurological disease indicators (e.g., Neurological.Disease.ALS, Neurological.Disease.PARKINSON.S.DISEASE) Site onset (Site..Onset.Onset..Bulbar, Site..Onset.Onset..Limb) Symptoms (Symptom.Atrophy, Symptom.Cramps, Symptom.Fasciculations, Symptom.Speech, etc.) Study arm indicators (Study.Arm.ACTIVE, Study.Arm.PLACEBO) Clinical measurements summary statistics (first, last, min, max, mean, sd, slope): ALSFRS scores, blood pressure, forced/slow vital capacity (fvc.liters, svc.liters), respiratory rate, weight, height ALSFRS subscale items: climbing.stairs, cutting, dressing, handwriting, salivation, speech, swallowing, turning, walking

title: ALS Data — als
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/ALS.txt

title: ALS Data — als
text: data kindly provided Lester Mackey Lilly Fang, won DREAM challenge prediction prize 2012 (Kuffner et al., 2015). includes additional variables created . winning entry used Bayesian trees, different random forests.

title: ALS Data — als
text: Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Section 17.2.

title: Baseball Batting Averages — baseball
text: Batting averages 18 Major League players 1970 season, Table 7.1. dataset illustrates empirical Bayes estimation, early-season performance used predict full-season batting averages.

title: Baseball Batting Averages — baseball
text: data frame 18 rows 3 variables: Player Player ID number MLE Batting average based first 90 -bats season TRUTH Batting average remainder 1970 season

title: Baseball Batting Averages — baseball
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/baseball.txt

title: Baseball Batting Averages — baseball
text: Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Table 7.1.

title: Bivariate Normal Data — bivnorm
text: 40 points generated bivariate normal distribution, entries missing. Figure 9.3.

title: Bivariate Normal Data — bivnorm
text: data frame 40 rows 2 variables: X1 First variable X2 Second variable

title: Bivariate Normal Data — bivnorm
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/bivnorm.csv

title: Bivariate Normal Data — bivnorm
text: Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Figure 9.3.

title: Butterfly Species Data — butterfly
text: Number butterfly species seen given number times two years trapping. Table 6.2. frequency data frame.

title: Butterfly Species Data — butterfly
text: data frame 24 rows 2 variables: k Number times species trapped count Number species seen exactly k times (e.g., 118 species trapped just , 74 trapped twice )

title: Butterfly Species Data — butterfly
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/butterfly.txt

title: Butterfly Species Data — butterfly
text: Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Table 6.2.

title: Cell Infusion Data — cellinfusion
text: Human cell colonies infused mouse nuclei 5 different ratios 1 5 days. Table 8.2.

title: Cell Infusion Data — cellinfusion
text: data frame 25 rows 4 variables: thrived Number cells thrived N Colony size (number cells) ratio Ratio mouse nuclei human cells (1-5) time Day observation (1-5)

title: Cell Infusion Data — cellinfusion
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/cellinfusion.txt

title: Cell Infusion Data — cellinfusion
text: Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Table 8.2.

title: Cholesterol Data — cholesterol
text: Cholestyramine, proposed cholesterol lowering drug, administered 164 men average seven years . Figure 20.1.

title: Cholesterol Data — cholesterol
text: data frame 164 rows 2 variables: compliance Fraction intended dose actually taken (standardized) cholesterol.decrease Decrease cholesterol level course experiment

title: Cholesterol Data — cholesterol
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/cholesterol.txt

title: Cholesterol Data — cholesterol
text: Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Figure 20.1.

title: Diabetes Data — diabetes
text: Data 442 diabetes patients used Section 7.3. response quantitative measure disease progression one year baseline. ten baseline predictors: age, sex, body-mass index, average blood pressure, six blood serum measurements.

title: Diabetes Data — diabetes
text: data frame 442 rows 12 variables: X Row index age Age patient sex Sex patient bmi Body mass index map Average blood pressure (mean arterial pressure) tc Total cholesterol (serum measurement) ldl Low-density lipoproteins (serum measurement) hdl High-density lipoproteins (serum measurement) tch Total cholesterol / HDL (serum measurement) ltg Log triglycerides (serum measurement) glu Blood sugar level (serum measurement) prog Response: quantitative measure disease progression

title: Diabetes Data — diabetes
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/diabetes.csv

title: Diabetes Data — diabetes
text: First used LARS paper (Efron et al., 2004). Note: Table 7.2, centered predictor variables standardized unit L2 norm. Table 20.1 standardized unit variance.

title: Diabetes Data — diabetes
text: Efron, B., Hastie, T., Johnstone, . Tibshirani, R. (2004). Least Angle Regression. Annals Statistics, 32(2), 407-499. Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Section 7.3.

title: Dose Response Data — doseresponse
text: Data 11 groups mice (10 ) exposed drug Xilathon different doses. Figure 8.2.

title: Dose Response Data — doseresponse
text: data frame 11 rows 2 variables: Dose Log dose level (step doubling) Proportion Proportion mice died dose

title: Dose Response Data — doseresponse
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/doseresponse.txt

title: Dose Response Data — doseresponse
text: Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Figure 8.2.

title: DTI Brain Imaging Data — DTI
text: Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) data comparing 6 dyslexic children 6 normal controls, Figures 15.9 15.10. Z scores computed 15,443 three-dimensional brain coordinates (voxels).

title: DTI Brain Imaging Data — DTI
text: data frame 15443 rows 4 variables: x Voxel coordinate: back front y Voxel coordinate: left right z Voxel coordinate: bottom top Zscore Z score comparing dyslexic vs normal controls voxel

title: DTI Brain Imaging Data — DTI
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/DTI.csv

title: DTI Brain Imaging Data — DTI
text: Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Figures 15.9 15.10.

title: Galaxy Data — galaxy
text: Counts galaxies binned redshift magnitude, Table 8.5. data reshaped long format variables magnitude, redshift category, frequency count.

title: Galaxy Data — galaxy
text: data frame 270 rows 3 variables: mag Magnitude category (1-18) red Redshift category (1-15) freq Number galaxies bin

title: Galaxy Data — galaxy
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/galaxy.txt

title: Galaxy Data — galaxy
text: Efron, B. Hastie, T. (2016). Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press, Table 8.5.

title: Human Ancestry Haplotype Data — haplotype
text: Genotype data 197 US individuals 4 racial groups (African American, European, Japanese, African) 100 SNP locations. Section 13.5.

title: Human Ancestry Haplotype Data — haplotype
text: data frame 197 rows 102 variables. first column X row index, race racial/ethnic group identifier, remaining 100 columns (Snp1 Snp100) contain genotype values (0, 1, 2) SNP location, NA missing values.

title: Human Ancestry Haplotype Data — haplotype
text: https://hastie.su.domains/CASI_files/DATA/haplotype.csv

title: Human Ancestry Haplotype Data — haplotype
